item.title: 美国公司推迟发布影响报告，DEI、ESG 受到攻击
item.description:
耐克和摩根大通等公司正在推迟或改变可持续发展和多元化报告的发布时间。【原文：

Nike and JPMorgan are on a list of companies that are pushing back or changing the release timing of sustainability and diversity reports.

】

item.title: 南非央行称南非保险公司将面临气候压力测试
item.description: 南非央行计划将气候风险审查扩大到保险业，因为它试图预测可能造成深远经济损失的威胁。【原文：South Africa’s central bank plans to expand its examination of climate risk to the insurance industry, as it seeks to anticipate threats that can do far-reaching economic harm.】

item.title: 瑞士承诺为冰川受灾村庄提供 600 万美元支持
item.description: 瑞士政府提议向阿尔卑斯山上的布拉滕村捐赠 500 万瑞士法郎（约合 600 万美元），该村上周被岩石和冰浪摧毁。【原文：The Swiss government is proposing to give 5 million francs ($6 million) to the Alpine village of Blatten that was destroyed by a wave of rock and ice last week.】

item.title: 香港跟踪可能发展成 2025 年首个台风的系统
item.description: 香港气象局正在菲律宾以东的温暖海域跟踪一个热带扰动，它可能在下周发展成本季第一个台风。【原文：Hong Kong’s weather bureau is tracking a tropical disturbance spinning in the warm waters east of the Philippines, which may develop into the first typhoon of the season next week.】

item.title: 烧树发电不可持续
item.description:
只有当英国政府能够制定出更好的愿景并付诸实施时，继续支持 Drax 集团才有意义。【原文：

Continued support for Drax Group will only make sense if the UK government can detail a better vision — and execute it. 

】

item.title: 极端天气考验着印度的基础设施建设事业
item.description: 印度今年的季风是 2009 年以来最早的一次，破坏了全国各地新建的公共基础设施，给印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪推动世界第五大经济体基础设施升级带来了压力。【原文：Indian monsoons this year — the earliest onset since 2009 — damaged new public infrastructure across the country, putting pressure on Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s push for an infrastructure upgrade in the world’s fifth-largest economy.】

item.title: 加拿大油砂排放强度连续六年下降
item.description: 阿尔伯塔省政府周四公布的最新数据显示，加拿大油砂行业在 2023 年连续第六年减少了每桶油砂的排放量，尽管该行业中越来越大的一部分正朝着相反的方向发展。【原文：Canada’s oil sands industry reduced its emissions per barrel for the sixth straight year in 2023, even as one growing portion of the sector moved in the opposite direction, according to new Alberta government data released Thursday.】

item.title: 研究发现：割掉犀牛角是对犀牛最好的保护
item.description: 在过去 15 年里，由于偷猎，犀牛的数量急剧下降。研究人员在南部非洲进行了一项为期七年的研究，结果表明，保护犀牛的最好和最便宜的方法就是割掉它们的角。【原文：The best and cheapest way to protect rhinos, whose population has plummeted over the last 15 years because of poaching, is to cut off their horns, according to researchers who carried out a seven-year study in southern Africa.】

item.title: 1893 年以来最干旱的春季过后，英格兰水库蓄水量进一步下降
item.description: 英格兰各地的水库水位远远低于正常水平，一个多世纪以来最干旱的春季进一步引发了人们对夏季来临前供水的担忧。【原文：Reservoir levels across England fell far below the norm as the driest spring in more than a century raises further concerns about water supplies ahead of summer.】

item.title: 绿色转型需要更多工人
item.description: 美国和英国政府都说他们需要更多的技术工人，但今天的时事通讯解释说，他们正在竭尽全力把这些工人赶走。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读全文，并与您的朋友和关注者分享。如需无限制地获取气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：The US and UK governments say they want more skilled workers, but today’s newsletter explains they're doing everything they can to push them away. You can read and share the full story with your friends and followers on Bloomberg.com. For unlimited access to climate and energy news, please subscribe.】

item.title: 欧洲电力市场为夏季酷热做好准备
item.description: 北欧 6 月的开端凉爽潮湿，夏季极端天气将接踵而至，这将扰乱日益依赖太阳能和风能的能源市场。【原文：A cool, wet start to June in Northern Europe is set to give way to a summer of extreme weather, roiling energy markets that have become increasingly dependent on solar and wind power.】

item.title: 煤电成本攀升正值特朗普希望扶持煤电燃料之际
item.description: 据一份新报告称，尽管唐纳德-特朗普总统正在大力扶持美国煤炭行业，但用这种最脏的化石燃料发电正变得越来越昂贵，越来越缺乏竞争力。【原文：While President Donald Trump is pushing to prop up the US coal industry, generating power from the dirtiest fossil fuel is becoming increasingly expensive and uncompetitive, according to a new report.】

item.title: 特朗普的税收法案将抑制但不会阻碍清洁能源的发展
item.description:
BNEF的分析发现，到2035年，美国太阳能、风能和储能的新增装机量将下降10%，其中风能受到的冲击最大。【原文：

US additions to solar, wind and storage would drop 10% by 2035, with wind hit the hardest, a BNEF analysis finds. 

】

item.title: 梅塔核电协议凸显人工智能电力需求缺口迫在眉睫
item.description: Meta Platforms 公司本周与核电达成的华丽交易只是技术行业需要更多能源和更快发展的最新迹象。尽管美国顶级反应堆公司急于签订更多合同，但最大的问题仍然存在：新能源能否迅速投入使用？【原文：Meta Platforms Inc.’s flashy deal this week for nuclear power was just the latest sign of the technology industry’s need for more energy — and fast. And while the top US reactor companies are eager to sign more contracts, the big question remains: Will new generation come online quickly enough?】

item.title: 人工智能热潮有可能使英国进一步偏离 2030 年碳减排目标
item.description: 英国依赖可再生能源的扩张速度太慢，无法满足数据中心蓬勃发展的电力需求，因此有可能无法实现 2030 年的脱碳目标。【原文：Britain is relying on a renewables expansion that is too slow to meet the booming power needs of data centers and risks missing its 2030 decarbonization targets as a result.】

item.title: 劳动力短缺阻碍了急需的电气化进程
item.description:
从热泵的缓慢推广到数据中心目标的落空，熟练工人的缺乏使得一切电气化变得更加困难。【原文：

From the slow roll-out of heat pumps to missed data center targets, a lack of skilled workers is making it much harder to electrify everything.

】

item.title: 中国建设十年来最多燃煤电厂保障电力安全
item.description: 据国际能源机构（International Energy Agency）称，随着世界上两个人口最多的国家寻求加强能源安全，中国和印度已批准建设十年来容量最大的新燃煤发电厂。【原文：China and India have approved the construction of the largest capacity of new coal-fired power plants in a decade, as the world’s two most populous nations seek to bolster energy security, according to the International Energy Agency.】

item.title: 参议院将增加公共土地出让以帮助支付特朗普的减税政策
item.description: 据一位重要议员透露，参议院共和党人计划将出售公共土地纳入唐纳德-特朗普总统的大规模减税方案。【原文：Senate Republicans plan to add the sale of public land into their version of President Donald Trump’s massive package of tax cuts, according to a key lawmaker.】

item.title: 没有足够的工程师来满足全球日益增长的电力需求
item.description:
富裕国家的人口老龄化和反移民言论迫使电力基础设施建设公司寻找创造性的解决方案。【原文：

Aging populations and anti-immigration rhetoric in rich countries are forcing companies building electricity infrastructure to find creative solutions.

】

item.title: 卢特尼克表示，尽管存在关键职位空缺，但飓风中心人员充足
item.description: 商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克在国会听证会上说，美国国家飓风中心人员配备齐全，尽管随着飓风季节的到来，一些关键职位还没有填补。【原文：Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick told a congressional hearing that the US National Hurricane Center was fully staffed even though key positions are going unfilled as hurricane season begins.】

item.title: 石油产量恢复，阿尔伯塔省野火危险因降雨而减弱
item.description: 第二天的降雨减缓了阿尔伯塔省野火的蔓延，使部分油砂生产得以恢复。【原文：A second day of rain slowed the spread of wildfires in Alberta, allowing some oil sands production to be restored.】

item.title: 热量正在以意想不到的方式改变寄生虫传播疾病的方式
item.description:
科学家们正在研究是什么让寄生虫在炎热的天气中茁壮成长或死亡。【原文：

Scientists are digging into what makes parasites thrive or die during hot weather.

】

item.title: 解读阻碍中美贸易和平的稀土之争
item.description: 5 月初，中美两国在日内瓦就降低关税和其他壁垒达成一致，市场为之欢呼。但几周后，这一协议的光芒开始褪去，中国指责美国通过新的限制措施违反了协议，而美国则称中国未能兑现在稀土方面的承诺。【原文：Markets cheered in early May when the US and China agreed in Geneva to lower tariffs and other barriers. But after a few weeks, the shine started to come off that deal, with China accusing the US of violating it with new restrictions and the US saying China failed to honor promises on rare earths.】

item.title: 野火促使赫德贝公司和阿拉莫斯黄金公司撤离加拿大矿山
item.description: 加拿大野火肆虐，在资源丰富的西部省份，热浪和狂风将火苗推向各处，一些采矿作业被迫撤离。【原文：Raging Canadian wildfires have forced evacuations from several mining operations as heat and wind push flames across the resource-rich western provinces.】

item.title: 英国银行家批评绿色金融缺乏风险偏好
item.description: 英国国家财富基金（National Wealth Fund）的一位高级管理人员批评了英国的银行和资金管理公司，认为它们未能接受推动低碳转型所需的风险水平。【原文：A senior executive at the UK’s National Wealth Fund has criticized the country’s banks and money managers for what he characterized as their failure to embrace the risk levels needed to drive the low-carbon transition.】

item.title: 克里称 COP30 气候谈判需要 "更细致入微的合作
item.description: 美国前国务卿、总统气候问题特使约翰-克里说，随着 COP30 的临近，围绕应对气候变化的政治动态比一年前复杂得多。【原文：With COP30 approaching, the political dynamic around addressing climate change is much more complicated than it was a year ago, said John Kerry, former US Secretary of State and Special Presidential Envoy for Climate.】

item.title: 欧洲的风能萧条推高了今年的碳排放量
item.description: 由于风灾迫使各国更多地依赖化石燃料为经济提供动力，欧洲今年的碳排放量攀升。【原文：European carbon emissions have climbed this year as a wind drought forces countries to rely more on fossil fuels to power their economies.】

item.title: Lucid 签订美国石墨协议，争夺国内电池材料市场
item.description: 汽车制造商 Lucid Group Inc. 签订了第三份美国加工石墨协议，扩大了其电动汽车电池重要组件的国内供应。【原文：Automaker Lucid Group Inc. signed a third agreement for US-processed graphite, extending its bid for domestic supplies of an essential component in its electric vehicle batteries.】

item.title: 欧盟发布缓解水资源短缺和限制数据中心使用的计划
item.description: 欧盟公布了在整个集团内提高抗旱能力和改善水质的计划，包括对蓬勃发展的 IT 行业进行用量检查的措施。【原文：The European Union unveiled plans to boost resilience to droughts and improve water quality across the bloc, including measures to place usage checks on the booming IT sector.】

item.title: 欧盟将于 6 月中旬推出终止俄罗斯能源进口的工具
item.description: 欧盟行政部门计划在本月中旬提交法规草案，以便在 2027 年底之前逐步停止进口俄罗斯能源。【原文：The European Union’s executive branch plans to present draft regulations in the middle of this month to phase out Russian energy imports by the end of 2027.】
